It was our hope that by this time things would be returning back to “normal”. However, as you know, that is not the case. With the increasing number of COVID-19 cases in the state and with the current restrictions that are placed on school events, it has become evident that having a Prom will not be able to happen. It is unfortunate that we have to announce at this time the 2020 South Side Jr/Sr. Prom will be cancelled.

As for graduation, a plan has been submitted to the State Department of Education for approval. Graduation is still scheduled for July 26, at 2:00 pm, in the Fine Arts Building. However, if the plan is approved, know that limits will be placed on how many people may attend and Health Department guidelines must be followed. More details will follow once the plan is approved. We do have a backup plan for graduation if the State does not approve the currently submitted plan or if the State tightens restrictions.

AAA Extends “Covid-19 Dead Period” For Schools

Due to the continued spreading of the COVID-19, and after the announcement of the closure of Arkansas schools through the end of the school year, the AAA will extend the “Covid-19 Dead Period” for all AAA member schools through May 30, 2020.

During this time, coaches shall be prohibited from engaging in any type of face to face contact whether it be practicing, training, weight lifting, tryouts, competition or travel. Further, school athletic facilities will be closed during this period. The AAA will work with the Department of Health, Department of Education, and the Governor's office later in May to announce plans following May 30.

We continue to encourage coaches to use technology to keep up with their students during this tough time.

Dear Parents/Guardians:

One of our chief concerns during this mandated school closing is providing meals to our students. Beginning Tuesday, March 17th, South Side School District will utilize two methods to provide meals. Although students are dismissed from school, all bus routes will run between 10:30 - 11:30 a.m. for the remainder of this week. On each bus there will be meals for all students who typically ride that particular bus. Extra meals will be available for younger children if needed. We ask that parents and children watch closely for the arrival of the bus and be prepared to accept meals or communicate to the bus driver if the meal is not needed. Also daily, between 11:15 to 12:15, the cafeteria will be open for students who can come by the school. All meals prepared at the cafeteria will be for take out only. Inside dining will not be allowed. All meals are being provided free to all children 18 years and younger. If you have any questions please feel free to contact me directly at ahosman@southsidebb.org.

Thank You

Dr. Hosman

We have been and will continue to be in contact with local law enforcement. There will be an additional officer on duty on August 29. If you have any questions, please feel free to call.

-Aaron Hosman, Superintendent of Schools
